title: How to Change the Default Download Location in Any Web Browser

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+E to open File Explorer .
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + E to open File Explorer . You can change the default download location for all your Windows programs here. You can also open File Explorer by right-clicking the Start menu and selecting File Explorer .

steps.title: Right-click Downloads and select Properties.
steps.content: Right-click Downloads and select Properties . You can find the Downloads folder in the Quick Access menu in the menu bar on the left.

steps.title: Click the Location tab.
steps.content: Click the Location tab. The Location tab is at the top of the Properties menu.

steps.title: Click Move.
steps.content: Click Move . It's the middle button below the bar that contains the path to the Downloads folder.

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location. Click the folder to select it, and then click Select Folder in the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . This sets the folder as the default location for all your downloaded files. If prompted, click Yes to confirm the new location.

steps.title: Click the Menu icon ⋮.
steps.content: Click the Menu icon ⋮ . It's the button with three dots in the upper-right corner. You can change the download location for Chrome in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu. This opens the Settings menu in a new tab.

steps.title: Click Downloads.
steps.content: Click Downloads . It's near the bottom of the menu on the left side.

steps.title: Click Change.
steps.content: Click Change . It's next to the bar that says "Location."

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location. Click the folder to select it, then click Select Folder in the bottom-right corner. This changes the default download location for the files you download in Chrome. Alternatively, click the toggle switch next to "Ask where to save each file before downloading." This will prompt you to select a location and a file name every time you download a file using Google Chrome. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Safari menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the Safari menu and select Settings . You'll see the Safari menu at the top of the screen when Safari is open.

steps.title: Click the General tab.
steps.content: Click the General tab. It's the tab with an icon resembling a gear at the top of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Select Other from the drop-down menu next to "File download location."
steps.content: Select Other from the drop-down menu next to "File download location." This allows you to select a different location for the files you download using Safari. Alternatively, you can click Ask for each download." This will prompt you to select a download location each time you download a file using Safari.

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your download location. Click the folder to select it, then click Select in the lower-right corner. This changes the default download location for the files you download using Safari. [2] X Research source You can also click New Folder to create a new folder for your downloads.

steps.title: Click the menu button ⋯ and select Downloads.
steps.content: Click the menu button ⋯ and select Downloads . This displays your downloads list at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click the menu button in the Downloads window ⋯.
steps.content: Click the menu button in the Downloads window ⋯ . This icon is the three dots in the upper-right corner of the Downloads window. This displays a separate menu for your downloads.

steps.title: Click Download settings.
steps.content: Click Download settings . It's next to an icon that resembles a gear in the Downloads menu.

steps.title: Click Change next to "Location."
steps.content: Click Change next to "Location."

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location. Navigate to the folder to which you want to save your files. Click the folder to select it, then click Select Folder in the bottom-right corner. This changes the default Download location for the files you download using Microsoft Edge. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Alternatively, click the toggle switch next to "Ask me what to do with each download." This will prompt you to select a download location and give the file a file name each time you download a file with Microsoft Edge.

steps.title: Click the menu button ☰ and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the menu button ☰ and select Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Browse next to "Save files to."
steps.content: Scroll down and click Browse next to "Save files to." It's in the "Files and Applications" section below the "Downloads" header.

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your default download location. Navigate to the folder to which you want to save your files. Click the folder to select it, then click Select Folder in the bottom-right corner. This changes the default download location for the files you download using Firefox . Alternatively, you can click the checkbox next to "Always ask you where to save files." This will prompt you to select where you want to download a file and give it a file name every time you want to download a file.

steps.title: Click the Mail menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the Mail menu and select Settings . The Mail menu appears in the menu bar when the Mail app is open.

steps.title: Click the General tab.
steps.content: Click the General tab. It's the tab with an icon resembling a gear at the top of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu next to "Downloads folder."
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu next to "Downloads folder." This displays a menu.

steps.title: Click Other.
steps.content: Click Other . This allows you to select a different folder for the files and attachments you download using Mail.

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your download location. Navigate to the folder to which you want to download your files. Click the folder to select it and then click Select in the lower-right corner. This changes the default download location for the files you download using Mail. [4] X Research source
